section1.good_choice_item1: Florida's Natural Orange Juice With Pulp
section1.good_choice_reason1: provide a boost in your fruit intake with its 100% juice content
section1.good_choice_reason2: contribute to your whole grains, which are important for providing fiber and nutrients
section1.good_choice_item3: Applegate Naturals Chicken & Maple Breakfast Sausage Links
section1.good_choice_reason3: increase your total protein intake with a lean protein source

section2.user_goals: reduce added sugar, reduce sodium, and increase vegetable intake

goal_feedback.feedback_text: Great work! You made great progress with reducing added sugar. This was due to your purchase of Smash Kitchen Organic Tomato Ketchup because it has minimal added sugars compared to other condiments.

Some choices this week didn’t align with your dietary goals. You purchased Smash Kitchen Organic Tomato Ketchup which didn’t contribute to your goal of reducing sodium because it contains high sodium levels.

Some choices this week didn’t align with your dietary goals. You purchased Smash Kitchen Organic Tomato Ketchup which didn’t contribute to your goal of increasing vegetable intake because it minimally contributes to vegetable servings.

section3.fruits_explanation: You did not have whole fruits in your basket which contributed to a low score. However, the inclusion of Florida's Natural Orange Juice contributed to the fruit score. Including whole fruits instead of primarily juices is beneficial because whole fruits contain more fiber and nutrients. Fruits are essential for providing vitamins, minerals, and fiber. Try getting more whole fruits next time!
section3.vegetables_explanation: You had a low vegetable score this week due to minimal vegetable products, such as Smash Kitchen Organic Tomato Ketchup. Vegetables are high in essential vitamins and minerals and low in calories, supporting overall health. Try getting more fresh or frozen vegetables next week.
section3.grains_explanation: The presence of Stonefire Original Mini Naan contributed to a good whole grains score. Whole grains are linked to a reduced risk of chronic diseases, such as heart disease and type 2 diabetes. Keep choosing whole grains!
section3.dairy_explanation: President All-Natural Feta Cheese Block contributed to this score, but overall dairy intake was low. Dairy products are essential for providing calcium, vitamin D, and potassium. Consider including more milk, yogurt, or alternative fortified products to enhance this score.
section3.protein_explanation: Applegate Naturals Chicken & Maple Breakfast Sausage Links and Great Value Frozen Raw Jumbo Shell-on contributed to a high protein score, reflecting a good balance of protein sources. Protein is necessary for building and repairing tissues. Keep up the great work!
section3.fattyacids_explanation: Your score was low partly due to a high intake of saturated fats found in items like Organic Valley Salted Organic Butter. Fatty acids, especially omega-3s, have been shown to improve heart health by reducing the risk of cardiovascular diseases. Try getting more sources of omega-3 fatty acids like salmon or flaxseeds next time.

section4.refinedgrains_explanation: You incorporated products like Stonefire Original Mini Naan, which offered balance in your refined grains score. Limiting refined grains prevents spikes in blood sugar and maintains steady energy levels. Nice job balancing with whole grains!
section4.sodium_explanation: The product Smash Kitchen Organic Tomato Ketchup raised the sodium levels significantly. High sodium intake can increase blood pressure and risk of cardiovascular outcomes. Opt for lower sodium alternatives next week for better health.
section4.addedsugars_explanation: You chose items with minimal added sugars, contributing to a high score supporting your goal. High added sugar intake can contribute to weight gain and dental problems. Keep it up!
section4.saturatedfats_explanation: A high level of saturated fats came from Organic Valley Salted Organic Butter, adversely impacting the score. Too much saturated fat can elevate cholesterol levels, increasing heart disease risk. Try reducing intake of high saturated fat foods next week.

section5.recommendation1: Organic Valley Salted Organic Butter contributed to negative saturated fat. Next week try opting for olive oil instead to strengthen the Fatty Acids score.
section5.recommendation2: Smash Kitchen Organic Tomato Ketchup contributed to high sodium. Next week try low-sodium versions of condiments to better align with your sodium goal.
section5.recommendation3: Lack of whole fruits contributed to a low fruit score. Next week try adding apples, bananas, or fresh berries to improve your whole fruits score.
